intro: Gomphandra ramuensis, commonly known as the Ramu gomphandra, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a distinctive glossy appearance. Gomphandra ramuensis is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments at higher altitudes.
